title.narrative: LPI, Programmatic Synergy for Improved Human Security, 2021 - 2024
LPI, Programmatic Synergy for Improved Human Security, 2021 - 2024

description.narrative:
Life and Peace Institute (LPI) har inkommit med en ansökan för en ny programfas med titeln "Enhancing Integrated Approaches for Improved Human Security in the HoA", för perioden 2021 - 2024. Programmet är formulerat utifrån en vision om att positivt påverka fred- och säkerhetsdynamiken i regionen genom en holistisk, preventionsbaserad ansats till regionala frågor vilka är informerade av verkligheten på marken genom att skapa utrymme för människor som vanligtvis inte är inkluderade och för samhällen som historiskt sett varit marginaliserade i beslutsfattande utrymmen/processer. Genom "Enhancing Integrated Approaches for Improved Human Security in the HoA" ämnar LPI att fokusera på tre tematiska områden: mänsklig säkerhet i gränsområden; övergångsrättvisa och försoning; klimatförändring-konflikt-nexus.
LPI kommer ansvara för övergipande implementering, styrning och rapportering av programmet. LPI kommer även vidareförmedla upp till 15% av medlen till civilsamhällesorganisationer under de olika tematiska områdena. Medlen kommer fördelas till väletablerade organisationer med historia av framgångsrik och överensstämmande bidragsimplementering vilken följer LPIs riktlinjer för vidareförmedling av medel. Den totala budgeten för implementering av det fyraåriga programmet är 60 000 000 SEK. Sveriges bidrag kommer vara totalt 52 500 000 SEK. EU kommer stödja programmet under de första sju månaderna av det första året, 2021.

Life and Peace Institute (LPI) has submitted the proposal for a new programme phase titled "Enhancing Integrated Approaches for Improved Human Security in the HoA", for the period from 2021 - 2024. The programme is formulated with a vision to positively impact the peace and security dynamics in the region through a holistic, prevention-focused approach to regional issues informed by realities on the ground through creating spaces for people who are not commonly included and communities who are historically marginalized in decision making spaces/processes. LPI through Enhancing Integrated Approaches for Improved Human Security in the HoA intends to focus on three thematic areas: Human Security in Borderlands; Transitional Justice and Reconciliation; the Climate Change-Conflict Nexus.
LPI will be responsible for overall implementation, management and reporting of the programme. LPI will also sub-grant upto 15% of the fund to CSOs under the different thematic areas. The grants will be awarded to well-established organizations with a history of successful and compliant grant implementation following LPI’s Grants Management Guidelines. The total budget for implementing the four year programme is SEK 60 000 000. Sweden's contribution will be a total of SEK 52 500 000 SEK. The EU will support the programme for the first seven months of the first year, 2021.

The overall vision of this second phase is to positively impact the peace and security dynamics in the region through a holistic, prevention-focused approach to regional issues informed by realities on the ground through creating spaces for people who are not commonly included and communities who are historically marginalized in decision making spaces/processes. LPI will work towards three outcome areas: 1, Civil society networking - enhanced networks of strengthened, diverse civil society actors articulate human security priorities and participate in regional policy engagement 2, understanding of challenges and options - deepened and expanded understanding of regional and national policy actors of human security challenges and possible courses of action 3, Policies and actions - human security responsive regional policy responses and actions developed and tested Three main thematic areas are also identified 1, Human security in borderlands 2, transitional justice and reconciliation 3, the climate change-conflict nexus
